newsArray.title: Ulimate redemption ‚Äì Can Alex Hales lead England to World Cup glory
newsArray.description: Cricket: Many thought Alex Hales' career for England was over but a shock recall and a stellar World Cup sees the opener one win away from ultimate redemption at the T20 World Cup.
newsArray.content: Cricket: Many thought Alex Hales' career for England was over but a shock recall and a stellar World Cup sees the opener one win away from ultimate redemption at the T20 World Cup.

newsArray.title: 1992 v 2022 ‚Äì Will history repeat itself for Pakistan?
newsArray.description: Cricket: Pakistan's path to World Cup glory in 1992 is eerily familiar to the path they've taken to the T20 World Cup Final. Will history repeat itself again when they meet England at the MCG?
newsArray.content: Cricket: Pakistan's path to World Cup glory in 1992 is eerily familiar to the path they've taken to the T20 World Cup Final. Will history repeat itself again when they meet England at the MCG?

newsArray.title: How Aussie greats are helping World Cup finalists

newsArray.title: T20 World Cup: History favours Pakistan, form is with England
creator: Press Trust of India
newsArray.description: MELBOURNE: A determined Babar Azam will be aiming to secure his seat beside the great Imran Khan in Pakistan cricket‚Äôs Hall of Fame as his team takes on a formidable England in the T20 World Cup final here on Sunday. The passage of 2009 champions into the final could even beat a Hollywood thriller script [‚Ä¶]
newsArray.content: MELBOURNE: A determined Babar Azam will be aiming to secure his seat beside the great Imran Khan in Pakistan cricket‚Äôs Hall of Fame as his team takes on a formidable England in the T20 World Cup final here on Sunday. The passage of 2009 champions into the final could even beat a Hollywood thriller script as they were down and out after the first week of the tournament with morale shattering defeats to arch-rivals India and Zimbabwe. Pakistan raised hopes of a dramatic comeback in the second week of a tournament with a win over South Africa and a prayer on their lips for some divine intervention. Just like in 1992, miracle happened when the Netherlands produced a performance for the ages to shock South Africa and out of nowhere, Pakistan were back in contention for a semifinal berth. Critics say that in cricket, you never know which Pakistan turns on a particular day and the semifinal performance against a well rounded New Zealand side showed that when it comes to playing edge of the seat ‚ÄòRussian Roulette‚Äô, the ‚ÄòGreen Machines‚Äô are second to none. But just like everyone wants a slice of ‚Äô92 from Babar‚Äôs team, the core of this current English team also has a date with history on this very Australian soil. Seven years ago in 2015, this was the country where England‚Äôs white ball cricket lay in tatters after they were dumped out of the competition at the group league stage by Bangladesh. The white ball cricket transformation started with horses for courses approach by the ECB, leading to a sea change in the mindset and intent of the English players. That fearless approach was on full display against India on Thursday. The Shaheen Shah Afridis, Mohammed Wasim Jr.and the Harris Raufs will need way more than just inspiration to get past the likes of Jos Buttler, Alex Hales, Ben Stokes and Moeen Ali. These are all sought after practitioners of T20 cricket and all of them have abilities to silence the 80,000 odd Pakistan fans, just like they did with the bulk of the 42,000 Indian fans in Adelaide. Can Afridi do a Wasim Akram when Buttler is batting or Babar and Rizwan take the game deep in their own style like Imran Khan and Javed Miandad did in that 1992 final. Big matches always brings big performer to the centre stage and Stokes for one wouldn‚Äôt mind a repeat of his 2019 Lord‚Äôs performance to win the silverware. The weather forecast predicts that the final could be marred by rain on both Sunday and the reserve day, which is Monday. Unlike a normal T20 game which could be a minimum five-over contest, the event technical committee has kept provisions for minimum 10-overs a side contest with an early (3 pm Melbourne time) start on reserve day if needed. On a spicy deck like the MCG, the presence of Mark Wood would have been an advantage but the tearaway quick‚Äôs back isn‚Äôt holding up well. Despite the pasting he got from Hardik Pandya, Chris Jordan is a fine T20 bowler in his own rights and would like to use his extensive BBL experience to get the better of the Pakistani batters. If both batting units are taken into account, England with Hales, Buttler, Stokes, Phil Salt (in place of Dawid Malan), Harry Brook, Moeen Ali and Liam Livingstone look stronger on paper against Pakistan with Rizwan, Babar, Shan Masood, Mohammed Haris and Iftikhar Ahmed. ‚ÄîPTI But on big days, it is not always the names that matter but also the mindset and temperament to last the distance. PTI T20 World Cup: History favours Pakistan, form is with England added by Press Trust of India on 12:07 am November 13, 2022 View all posts by Press Trust of India ‚Üí Press Trust of India Facebook Twitter WhatsApp Email Print Related

newsArray.title: Even Kohli not safe as India plot change after England drubbing
creator: Press Trust of India
newsArray.description: NEW DELHI: Virat Kohli and skipper Rohit Sharma could be victims of wholesale change to India‚Äôs Twenty20 team after the catastrophic World Cup semi-final defeat to England. England romped to a 10-wicket victory on Thursday at the Adelaide Oval, chasing down the 169-run target with four overs to spare to set up a final on [‚Ä¶]
newsArray.content: NEW DELHI: Virat Kohli and skipper Rohit Sharma could be victims of wholesale change to India‚Äôs Twenty20 team after the catastrophic World Cup semi-final defeat to England. England romped to a 10-wicket victory on Thursday at the Adelaide Oval, chasing down the 169-run target with four overs to spare to set up a final on Sunday against India‚Äôs arch-rivals Pakistan. Openers Alex Hales (86 not out) and Jos Buttler (80 not out) did the damage against a muted Indian bowling attack lacking both fire and fury. Cricket is by far the most popular sport in the world‚Äôs second most populous country, but India have not won a global title since the 2013 Champions Trophy and the painful wait goes on. The thrashing was met with disappointment, anger and demands for heads to roll. Reports on Friday said the T20 squad will start undergoing a major transition in the coming days, with prominent senior players including Rohit, Kohli and Ravichandran Ashwin being gradually eased out. Kohli hit four half-centuries at this World Cup, including heroics to beat Pakistan in India‚Äôs tournament opener, but at age 34 the superstar batsman is not seen as the future. ‚ÄúYou will not see most of the seniors playing T20 next year,‚Äù the Press Trust of India quoted a source in the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) as saying. The India team could look very different the next time the T20 World Cup comes along, in the US and West Indies in 2024. ‚ÄúAbsolutely not the right time to talk about this stuff or think about this stuff right now,‚Äù coach Rahul Dravid said in the aftermath of his team‚Äôs beating when asked about the future of his senior players. Former cricketer Sunil Valson told AFP that India were outplayed in every aspect against a ruthless England. ‚ÄúThe selectors must sit down and see and work out a new combination,‚Äù the former fast bowler said. Former India off-spinner Harbhajan Singh suggested India install a new head coach who has retired from playing more recently than Dravid, 49, and name Hardik Pandya as captain in place of Rohit. Batting great Sunil Gavaskar said that the Indian selectors had already ‚Äúsent the signal‚Äù to senior players by picking the 29-year-old Pandya as skipper for an upcoming T20 series in New Zealand. ‚ÄúThere could be retirements, there are a lot of players in their mid-30s who might consider their future in international T20s,‚Äù he said on air after the semi-final. POWERLESS POWER PLAY India are ranked the world‚Äôs top T20 team but they were criticised for slow scoring in the powerplay, huffing and puffing their way to 38-1 off their first six overs, while England raced to 63 without loss. Veteran journalist Rajdeep Sardesai said India needed new blood who were less conservative. ‚ÄúWe lost [the] game in the first 10 overs when we played timidly. Need a Gen next that bats at strike rate of 150-plus, and wicket-taking bowlers,‚Äù he tweeted. ‚ÄîAgencies Dravid acknowledged that the Indian cricket board‚Äôs ban on players entering overseas T20 tournaments, such as Australia‚Äôs Big Bash League (BBL), had hurt them. ‚ÄúA lot of our boys maybe do miss out on the opportunities of playing in a lot of these leagues,‚Äù he said. But allowing them to do so would eviscerate longer forms of the Indian game, he added. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs right in the middle of our season, and with the kind of demand there would be for Indian players, if you allowed all the Indian players to play in these leagues, we would not have a domestic cricket.‚Äù He added: ‚ÄúOur domestic trophy, our Ranji trophy, would be finished, and that would mean Test cricket would be finished.‚Äù Even Kohli not safe as India plot change after England drubbing added by Press Trust of India on 11:55 pm November 12, 2022 View all posts by Press Trust of India ‚Üí Press Trust of India Facebook Twitter WhatsApp Email Print Related

newsArray.title: Enjoyed opening batting more with Tendulkar than irender Sehwag: Ganguly
creator: Press Trust of India
newsArray.description: ABU DHABI: Former Indian cricket team captain Sourav Ganguly on Friday said he enjoyed opening the batting with Sachin Tendulkar more than he did with Virender Sehwag, as Sachin made him a better player. In a rapid fire round, Ganguly was asked, between Sachin and Sehwag, who he enjoyed opening the innings more with. ‚ÄúSachin [‚Ä¶]
newsArray.content: ABU DHABI: Former Indian cricket team captain Sourav Ganguly on Friday said he enjoyed opening the batting with Sachin Tendulkar more than he did with Virender Sehwag, as Sachin made him a better player. In a rapid fire round, Ganguly was asked, between Sachin and Sehwag, who he enjoyed opening the innings more with. ‚ÄúSachin was the most sane one and Sehwag was insane. So it‚Äôs Sachin. He actually also made me a better player,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúSachin actually got me lift my game.‚Äù To another question, which living person he admired the most, Ganguly against chose to name the little master. ‚ÄúSachin. He was special and I have seen him up close. I have seen him hit in rib cage. Did not make a noise. Got runs. The next morning he had a double fracture in ribs. ‚ÄúI heard a sound and I went and asked him you are okay. He said he was fine. The next morning he had fractures. He was special,‚Äù he said. On what was more challenging ‚Äî test in Australia or test in England, he said Australia. Asked to choose between what role he prefer to be in, captain of India and BCCI President, Ganguly chose to go with the cricket team. When asked to choose between India‚Äôs win in Kolkata test in 2001 at home or India‚Äôs win at Lords in Natwest Cup final in 2002, he said: ‚Äú2001 win at home as it changed the team. It changed the belief in team.‚Äù Ganguly named Sri Lankan spinner Muralidharan, especially as he was getting on in age, as someone who gave him nightmares. ‚ÄúOlder he became, the better he became. I found Murali the hardest when he was older,‚Äù Ganguly said. Before the rapid fire, Ganguly spoke at length about leadership and said it is important to listen to others. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not my way or highway,‚Äù he said and cited several examples. Having been in several leadership positions, he also talked about importance of having an eye to find the right talent and giving it adequate opportunity. ‚ÄúYou create an atmosphere to express themselves.‚Äù As a piece of advice, he suggested that one should retire from the game on a high. On how to handle pressure, Ganguly said it was all about training the mind. ‚ÄîPTI Enjoyed opening batting more with Tendulkar than irender Sehwag: Ganguly added by Press Trust of India on 11:54 pm November 12, 2022 View all posts by Press Trust of India ‚Üí Press Trust of India Facebook Twitter WhatsApp Email Print Related

newsArray.title: India vs New Zealand: Munish Bali to be India‚Äôs fielding coach in New Zealand
creator: Press Trust of India
newsArray.description: NEW DELHI: Munish Bali has been named fielding coach for India‚Äôs limited overs tour of New Zealand and will be part of the support staff headed by VVS Laxman. With the Rahul Dravid-led support staff being given a break post the T20 World Cup, Laxman will be the head coach on the tour beginning November [‚Ä¶]
newsArray.content: NEW DELHI: Munish Bali has been named fielding coach for India‚Äôs limited overs tour of New Zealand and will be part of the support staff headed by VVS Laxman. With the Rahul Dravid-led support staff being given a break post the T20 World Cup, Laxman will be the head coach on the tour beginning November 18 in Wellington. India will play three T20s and as many ODIs. Bali, Hrishikesh Kanitkar (batting coach) and Sairaj Bahutule (bowling coach) will be part of the support staff in New Zealand. All three coaches are based at the National Cricket Academy which is headed by Laxman. Bali was also part of the India squad in Ireland and briefly in England earlier this year before the doing the home series against South Africa. ‚ÄúAll three will assist Laxman in New Zealand,‚Äù said a BCCI official. ‚ÄîPTI India vs New Zealand: Munish Bali to be India‚Äôs fielding coach in New Zealand added by Press Trust of India on 11:54 pm November 12, 2022 View all posts by Press Trust of India ‚Üí Press Trust of India Facebook Twitter WhatsApp Email Print Related

newsArray.title: T20 World Cup: 'Indian cricket is at the lowest right now,' says Shoaib Akhtar
creator: FirstCricket Staff
newsArray.description: T20 World Cup: 'Indian cricket is at the lowest right now,' says Shoaib Akhtar
newsArray.content: Cricket T20 World Cup: 'Indian cricket is at the lowest right now,' says Shoaib Akhtar Shoaib Akhtar pointed out that India can't take solace from the fact that India reached semifinals of the T20 World Cup by beating Zimbabwe, the Netherlands. FirstCricket Staff November 12th, 2022 22:21:58 IST Shoaib Akhtar said India need to reconsider their leadership after T20 World Cup debacle. AP Following India‚Äôs disappointing performance in the T20 World Cup semifinal against England, former Pakistan speedster Shoaib Akhtar said Indian cricket is at its lowest with confusion in team selection, especially in the bowling department. Indian bowlers felt the ire of English openers, who took just 16 overs to chase down 169 without losing a wicket on an Adelaide surface that provided no swing during the match while Indian spinners Axar Patel and R Ashwin couldn‚Äôt make much out of the pitch that was gripping the ball. ‚ÄúIndian fast bowling ke paas express fast bowlers nahi hai. Cut-throat spinners nahi hain. Confusing selection ke saath India andar gaya, aur badi maar khaayi. Conditions ke fast bowlers hain India ke, jahan conditions mil gayi toh khelte rahenge. Lekin very disappointing performance from India. India doesn‚Äôt deserve to meet us in MCG, or allowed to take a flight to come to Melbourne, because unki cricket aaj expose hui hai. (India don‚Äôt have express fast bowlers or impactful spinners. They had a confusing selection. Their pacers can perform if conditions suit them),‚Äù said Akhtar on his Youtube channel. The 47-year-old retired bowler, who holds the record for fastest delivery, said India can‚Äôt really celebrate the fact that they reached the semifinal in a World Cup that had four good teams contending for the title while little solace could be taken from their run where they defeated the team ‚ÄúSemifinal tak pohochna kaunsi badi baat hai? 4 achhi teams hain total, unme se bhi Netherlands ko haraana ya Zimbabwe ko haraake pohoch jaana‚Ä¶ koi badi baat nahi hai. Indian cricket is at the lowest right now because when it comes to ICC events, India ko apni kaptaani dekhni hogi, management ko blame lena hoga, bowling department me confusing selection ke saath Shami ko uthaake le aaye. Achhe fast bowler hain lekin banta nahi tha. (What‚Äôs so big in reaching semis? There were 4 good teams in total. You beat Netherlands and Zimbabwe, nothing big. India need to look at their leadership, management needs to take accountability. It was a confusing selection),‚Äù he added. Read all the Latest News , Trending News , Cricket News , Bollywood News , India News and Entertainment News here. Follow us on Facebook , Twitter and Instagram . newsArray.title: Greg Barclay gets second term as ICC chairman, Jay Shah to head F&CA committee
creator: Post News Network
newsArray.description: Melbourne: New Zealand‚Äôs Greg Barclay was Saturday unanimously re-elected as chairman of the International Cricket Council (ICC) for a second two-year term. Besides Barclay‚Äôs re-election, BCCI secretary Jay Shah was elected as the head of ICC‚Äôs all-powerful Finance and Commercial Affairs (F&CA) committee at the board meeting. Barclay was unopposed following the withdrawal of Zimabwe‚Äôs [‚Ä¶]
newsArray.content: Greg Barclay gets second term as ICC chairman, Jay Shah to head F&CA committee PTI Updated: November 12th, 2022, 22:15 IST in Sports 0 Share on Facebook Share on Twitter Share on WhatsApp Share on Linkedin Melbourne: New Zealand‚Äôs Greg Barclay was Saturday unanimously re-elected as chairman of the International Cricket Council (ICC) for a second two-year term. Besides Barclay‚Äôs re-election, BCCI secretary Jay Shah was elected as the head of ICC‚Äôs all-powerful Finance and Commercial Affairs (F&CA) committee at the board meeting. Barclay was unopposed following the withdrawal of Zimabwe‚Äôs Tavengwa Mukuhlani from the process, and the ICC Board reaffirmed its full support to the New Zealander to continue at the helm. ‚ÄúIt is an honour to be re-elected as the Chair of the International Cricket Council and I would like to thank my fellow ICC Directors for their support,‚Äù said Barclay on his re-appointment. ‚ÄúOver the last two years we have made significant strides forward with the launch of our global growth strategy that provides clear direction to build a successful and sustainable future for our sport. ‚ÄúIt is an exciting time to be involved in cricket and I look forward to continuing to work closely with our Members to strengthen the game in our core markets as well as grow it beyond that, ensuring more of the world can enjoy cricket.‚Äù Barclay, an Auckland-based commercial lawyer, was originally appointed as the ICC Chair in November 2020. He was previously the Chair of New Zealand Cricket (NZC) and was a director of the ICC Men‚Äôs Cricket World Cup in 2015. He being elected unopposed also means that he had the backing of the mighty BCCI in the 17-member board. ‚ÄúI would like to congratulate Greg on his re-appointment as ICC Chair, as the continuity his leadership will provide is in the best interests of the sport. I therefore decided to withdraw my candidacy,‚Äù said Mukuhlani. Jay Shah to head F&CA committee ===================== Shah will have the responsibility of heading ICC‚Äôs most important committee. Al the major financial policy decisions are taken by the F&CA committee before it is ratified by the ICC board. ‚ÄúEach and every member accepted Jay as the head of F&CA committee. This is an equally powerful sub committee apart from the ICC chair (Greg Barclay),‚Äù an ICC source told PTI on conditions of anonymity. It includes the revenue sharing among the member nations and also the various major sponsorship deals that the global body inks through the year. The F&CA committee is always headed by an ICC Board member and Shah‚Äôs election makes it clear that he will represent the BCCI on the ICC Board. The F&CA head‚Äôs position used to be India‚Äôs during the N Srinivasan era but during Shashank Manohar‚Äôs tenure as ICC chairman, the BCCI‚Äôs power and might had significantly reduced. In fact during the Committee of Administrators‚Äô tenure, there was a point when BCCI didn‚Äôt even have any representation in the F&CA committee. Former BCCI president Sourav Ganguly was a member of the F&CA committee till last year. ‚ÄúIndia is a commercial hub of global cricket with more than 70 percent sponsorship coming from the region. It is imperative that an ICC F&CA should always be headed by BCCI,‚Äù the ICC source said. Ganguly to remain ICC Cricket Committee head ============================= Former India captain Ganguly, who completed his tenure as BCCI president last month, will remain the head of ICC‚Äôs Cricket Committee. PTI Tags: Greg Barclay ICC Jay Shah Share Tweet Send Share Suggest A Correction Enter your email to get our daily news in your inbox. newsArray.title: Pakistan vs England T20 World Cup final: 'Don't fail like we did in 1992 WC,' says Chris Lewis
creator: FirstCricket Staff
newsArray.description: Pakistan vs England T20 World Cup final: 'Don't fail like we did in 1992 WC,' says Chris Lewis
newsArray.content: Cricket Pakistan vs England T20 World Cup final: 'Don't fail like we did in 1992 WC,' says Chris Lewis Remembering the painful memories of the defeat, former English all-rounder Chris Lewis urged England to show up in the mega final unlike them in 1992. FirstCricket Staff November 12th, 2022 20:46:36 IST Paksitan defeated England in 50-over World Cup final in 1992 to lift their maiden world title. Twitter Pakistan vs England T20 World Cup final builds up as a rematch of 1992‚Äôs 50-over World Cup final that saw the Asian side triumph over the makers of the game at Melbourne Cricket Ground, which is also the venue for Sunday‚Äôs final. Remembering the painful memories of the defeat, former English all-rounder Chris Lewis urged Jos Buttler-led side to show up in the mega final unlike them 30 years ago. T20 World Cup Home | Schedule | Results | Points Table | T20 World Cup News | Photos ‚ÄúAt some point in that tournament, each of our players came to the fore and we had a great run. Every country played everyone else in the group stage and we were the best team,‚Äù Lewis told Daily Mail. ‚ÄúSo to get to the final and not show up was the disappointment. It‚Äôs the one thing I would be telling this England team to guard against. When you get to a final, a lot of the hard work has been done, but it‚Äôs the last part that everyone has come for ‚Äî the opportunity to be champions. You‚Äôve got to get over the line.‚Äù England head into the game high on confidence as they thrashed India by 10 wickets in the semifinals with Jos Buttler and Alex Hales dominating the experienced bowling line-up in Adelaide. However, Lewis feels presence of a left-arm pacer among Pakistan‚Äôs bowling ranks in Shaheen Afridi will be a crucial point in the marquee clash. ‚ÄúBowling left-arm is a wonderful weapon to have, when you do it at close to 90mph (145kmph approx.) and go full. If it swings, it means you are bringing lbw, bowled, everything into the equation in the powerplay, and against Pakistan that is a critical time of the game,‚Äù said Lewis, who played 32 Tests and 58 ODIs for England between 1990 and 1998. ‚ÄúWhat we saw against India in the semi-final was a lack of swing, which allowed our two guys at the top to charge away. So that makes the start of England‚Äôs innings a very interesting battle. If they can get over Afridi‚Äôs initial burst, it will set them up for the kind of score they‚Äôll need to win.‚Äù Lewis, however, added that England have serious pace in Mark Wood too and that will be a scare for Pakistan‚Äôs openers, irrespective of their forms. ‚ÄúThat bit of extra pace ‚Äî no, a lot of extra pace ‚Äî is always useful, especially against the Pakistan openers Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan. They have had their struggles at this World Cup but seem to have found their feet now and it‚Äôs important when England are bowling that they don‚Äôt settle. ‚ÄúIt is perhaps easier to knock the other England bowlers around because they do not possess the same threat as Wood, someone who‚Äôs been bowling at 95mph plus. If you look to take him on, it‚Äôs a real risk,‚Äù he said. Read all the Latest News , Trending News , Cricket News , Bollywood News , India News and Entertainment News here. Follow us on Facebook , Twitter and Instagram . Updated Date: November 12, 2022 20:46:36 IST Tags: Cricket Pakistan Vs England T20 World Cup T20 World Cup England Find latest and upcoming tech gadgets online on Tech2 Gadgets. newsArray.title: T20 World Cup final: 'Pakistan can't derail England's sixathon!' says Kevin Pietersen
creator: FirstCricket Staff
newsArray.description: T20 World Cup final: 'Pakistan can't derail England's sixathon!' says Kevin Pietersen
newsArray.content: Cricket T20 World Cup final: 'Pakistan can't derail England's sixathon!' says Kevin Pietersen Kevin Pietersen believes that England's incredible win against India in the semifinal shows they are the favourites to win the T20 World Cup Final against Pakistan. FirstCricket Staff November 12th, 2022 19:46:49 IST England defeated India by 10 wickets in semifinals to setup T20 World Cup final against Pakistan. AP As England and Pakistan are all set to square off in T20 World Cup final in Melbourne, in what is deemed as the rematch of 1992 World Cup final, Kevin Pietersen said only England can stop themselves from winning the title as he predicts it to be a ‚Äòsixathon‚Äô given the top form of English batters. T20 World Cup Home | Schedule | Results | Points Table | T20 World Cup News | Photos ‚ÄúPakistan needs to hope that England self-destructs by being reckless and overconfident. I think it‚Äôs an incredible strength that they can just go out there and play the way they do, but we do know that England can roll over for none because it‚Äôs a sixathon. That‚Äôs the only thing that I can see derailing England, and that‚Äôs what Pakistan needs to hope for, because I don‚Äôt think they can derail England themselves. I am predicting a comfortable win for England,‚Äù wrote Pietersen in his column for Betway . The former England captain confidence oozes from the fact that the English side thrash prime title contenders India by 10 wickets in the T20 World Cup semifinal in Adelaide on Thursday. Jos Buttler and Alex Hales scored 80-odd runs as England chased down 169 in just 16 overs. ‚ÄúThe England performance ranks right up there. It was convincing as anything because that Indian team is star-studded. To beat them as convincingly as they did was spectacular. I had little doubt about the result as India posted 169 on board. Adelaide is a good wicket, and I anticipated it to be an easy chase,‚Äù he added. newsArray.title: Sreedhar guides Kadapa to big win at Veterans Cricket T20 Tournament
creator: Telangana Today
newsArray.description: G Sreedhar scored 43-ball 85 to guide Kadapa Veterans to a thumping nine-wicket win over VCAH Secretary XI
newsArray.content: Home | News | Sreedhar Guides Kadapa To Big Win At Veterans Cricket T20 Tournament Sreedhar guides Kadapa to big win at Veterans Cricket T20 Tournament By Telangana Today Published: Published Date - 07:14 PM, Sat - 12 November 22 G Sreedhar scored 43-ball 85 to guide Kadapa Veterans to a thumping nine-wicket win over VCAH Secretary XI G Sreedhar scored 43-ball 85 to guide Kadapa Veterans to a thumping nine-wicket win over VCAH Secretary XI Hyderabad : G Sreedhar scored 43-ball 85 to guide Kadapa Veterans to a thumping nine-wicket win over VCAH Secretary XI in the Veterans Cricket T20 Tournament held in Hyderabad on Saturday. Kadapa‚Äôs Gandam Aswini Kumar and Balu snared two wickets each as they restricted Secretary XI to 121/5 in stipulated 20 overs. For Secretary XI, Srini Bhima and Nitesh Reddy hit 47 and 40 respectively. In reply, riding on Sreedhar‚Äôs half-century, Kadapa Veterans recorded a massive victory. Also Read Vijay Hazare Trophy: Rohit, Tilak centuries win it for Hyderabad In another match, VCAH President‚Äôs XI defeated Anantapur Veterans by eight wickets. Brief Scores: VCAH Secretary XI 121/5 in 20 overs (Srini Bhima 47, Nitesh Reddy 40; Balu 2/19, Gandam Aswini Kumar Raju 2/19) lost to Kadapa Veterans 124/1 in 11.4 Overs (G Sreedhar 85; Anand 1/17); Anantapur Veterans 97 in 18.2 overs (Yugandhar Reddy 28; Dr Giri 3/14) lost to VCAH President‚Äôs XI 98/2 in 10.4 Overs (Damodar 47). newsArray.title: TCA Nizamabad T20 league: Faisal‚Äôs five-wicket haul guides PCA CC to victory
creator: Telangana Today
newsArray.description: Faisal Khan snared five wickets for 20 while Zohaib Meraj scored an unbeaten half-century to guide PCA CC to a massive 10-wicket win
newsArray.content: Home | News | Tca Nizamabad T20 League Faisals Five Wicket Haul Guides Pca Cc To Victory TCA Nizamabad T20 league: Faisal‚Äôs five-wicket haul guides PCA CC to victory By Telangana Today Published: Published Date - 07:05 PM, Sat - 12 November 22 Faisal Khan snared five wickets for 20 while Zohaib Meraj scored an unbeaten half-century to guide PCA CC to a massive 10-wicket win Hyderabad: Faisal Khan snared five wickets for 20 while Zohaib Meraj scored an unbeaten half-century to guide PCA CC to a massive 10-wicket win over Bigala in the Telangana Cricket Association (TCA) Nizamabad District Seniors T20 League held at the Shailaja Grounds, Nizamabad on Saturday. Faisal Khan restricted Bigala XI to 112/8 in 18 overs. Sampath Goud‚Äôs (52) half-century went in vain. In response, Zohaib Meraj hit unbeaten 62 while Asif Ali scored 26 not out to guide the side to home. Also Read Naseem bowls Ilyas XI to victory at TCA Nizamabad T20 league In another match, Praveen Kumar scalped three as MCC XI defeated Jimmy XI by 60 runs. For Jimmy, V V Laxman and Prabha picked-up four and three wickets respectively. Brief Scores: Bigala XI 112/8 in 18 Overs (Sampath Goud 52, Sai 22, Faisal Khan 5/20) lost to PCA CC 113/0 in 12.2 overs (Zohaib Meraj 62no, Asif Ali 26no); MCC XI 139/8 in 18 Overs (Rupinder Singh 56, Sajid 31, V V Laxman 4/20, Prabha 3/22) bt Jimmy XI 79/9 in 15.2 Overs (Praveen Kumar 3/11); TCA Seniors Inter-Districts One Day League: Mancherial 151 in 27.4 Overs (A Shithikanta 37, Shiva Teja 4/18) bt Asifabad 110 in 28.2 Overs (Shiva Teja 28, A Sanjeev 5/42). newsArray.title: 'Aap mein or hum mein fark yahi hai': Irfan Pathan gives befitting reply to Pak PM for trolling India after WC exit
creator: FP Trending
newsArray.description: 'Aap mein or hum mein fark yahi hai': Irfan Pathan gives befitting reply to Pak PM for trolling India after WC exit
newsArray.content: Cricket 'Aap mein or hum mein fark yahi hai': Irfan Pathan gives befitting reply to Pak PM for trolling India after WC exit After India‚Äôs defeat, Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif rubbed salts into the wound with a tricky Tweet. FP Trending November 12th, 2022 18:21:53 IST Irfan Pathan gives befitting reply to Pakistan's PM. Image: Irfan Pathan/Twitter Former India cricketer Irfan Pathan came up with a stern response to Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif‚Äôs sarcastic tweet after India‚Äôs disappointing exit from the ICC T20 World Cup. Team India‚Äôs dream of lifting their second T20 World Cup title came to an end after the side slumped to a thumping 10-wicket defeat against England in the second semi-final. With India‚Äôs exit, cricket enthusiasts who were waiting for an India-Pakistan battle in the final, were left disheartened. However, some Pakistan fans also slammed the Rohit Sharma-led unit for failing on the occasion despite being one of the tournament favourites. In this context, Prime Minister Sharif also joined them in rubbing salts into the wound with a tricky tweet. So, this Sunday, it‚Äôs: 152/0 vs 170/0 üáµüá∞ üá¨üáß #T20WorldCup ‚Äî Shehbaz Sharif (@CMShehbaz) November 10, 2022 Referring to Pakistan‚Äôs 10-wicket triumph over India in the 2021 T20 World Cup Group stage, Sharif wrote, ‚ÄúSo, this Sunday, it‚Äôs 152/0 vs 170/0.‚Äù The remark unquestionably did not go down well with Indian fans. They brutally criticised the Pakistan PM for making this kind of statement despite being such a respectable figure. Now, Pathan has taken a step forward and replied to Sharif‚Äôs post. Aap mein or hum mein fark yehi hai. Hum apni khushi se khush or aap dusre ke taklif se. Is liye khud ke mulk ko behtar karne pe dhyan nahi hai. ‚Äî Irfan Pathan (@IrfanPathan) November 12, 2022 The ex-India player stated, ‚ÄúAap mein or hum mein fark yehi hai. Hum apni khushi se khush or aap dusre ke taklif se. Is liye khud ke mulk ko behtar karne pe dhyan nahi hai. (This is the difference between you and us. We are happy with our happiness and you, with others‚Äô pain. That is why you can‚Äôt focus on the development of your own country).‚Äù In the comment section, a lot of Indian supporters took a stand by Pathan and appreciated his words. Pakistan and England will square off for the T20 World Cup Final on Saturday at the Melbourne Cricket Ground. However, according to weather experts, the title bout can be affected by rain. The highly anticipated game is now potentially in danger due to the La Nina weather phenomenon. The top clash can be shifted to the reserve day on Monday since the Bureau of Meteorology forecasts a 95% chance of rain in the Victorian Capital on Sunday evening. Updated Date: November 12, 2022 18:21:53 IST Tags: Cricket Irfan Pathan T20 World Cup T20 World Cup India Find latest and upcoming tech gadgets online on Tech2 Gadgets. newsArray.title: Jay Shah trends on Twitter after being elected as head of ICC‚Äôs F&CA Committee
creator: Telangana Today
newsArray.description: Hyderabad: The current BCCI secretary Jay Shah has been appointed as the head of the Finance and Commercial Affairs Committee of the International Cricket Council (ICC). The F&CA Committee of the International Cricket Council deals with budget issues related to member countries of the ICC. Jay Shah, also the president of the Asian Cricket Council, [‚Ä¶]
newsArray.content: Home | Sport | Jay Shah Trends On Twitter After Being Elected As Head Of Iccs Fca Committee Jay Shah trends on Twitter after being elected as head of ICC‚Äôs F&CA Committee By Telangana Today Published: Published Date - 06:03 PM, Sat - 12 November 22 Jay Shah Hyderabad: The current BCCI secretary Jay Shah has been appointed as the head of the Finance and Commercial Affairs Committee of the International Cricket Council (ICC). The F&CA Committee of the International Cricket Council deals with budget issues related to member countries of the ICC. Jay Shah, also the president of the Asian Cricket Council, was re-appointed as the secretary of the Indian cricket board for the second term. On the other hand, New Zealand‚Äôs Greg Barclay was re-elected as chairman of the International Cricket Council. ICC chairman is elected every two years. Also Read Jay Shah confirms India won‚Äôt travel to Pakistan for Asia Cup 2023 India‚Äôs female cricketers to earn same amount of match fees as the men The decisions were taken during the ICC election that was held today in Melbourne, Australia. The newly elected president Roger Binny and Jay Shah from India took part in the elections. Jay Shah, Sourav Ganguly, and Roger Binny are expected to attend the T20 World Cup final that is scheduled to take place on Sunday at the Melbourne Cricket Ground. While many are happy with the decision, a few are taking a dig at Jay Shah for engaging in politics and nepotism in both BCCI and ICC elections. Check out a few reactions here: Breaking : In a massive war against nepotism, Sh. Jay Shah have become Head of Finance and commercial affairs committee of International Cricket Council. Sh. Shah have been famous all rounder and a big name in the field of cricket. BJP has again waged a war on Nepotism. ‚Äî Anshuman Sail (@AnshumanSail) November 12, 2022 BJP cries 24/7 about the Nepotism, But when Jay Shah a Product of Nepotism who has no links to sports or cricket and who can't even wave Indian flag when India wins is still sitting as BCCI president. Shame on BJP.üòê pic.twitter.com/xmk4aFgoVk ‚Äî Hazelnut (@ImEsthy) November 11, 2022 Jay Shah appointed as head of powerful ICC's Finance and Commercial Affairs (F&CA) committee pic.twitter.com/YbLfmQbGdf ‚Äî SP Singh (@Saurabhengg87) November 12, 2022 Very well done jay shah, with 2000 international wickets and 56000 runs in international cricket, you truly deserve this place ‚ù§Ô∏è ‚Äî Dr Nimo Tyagi (@niiravmodi) November 12, 2022 High time Rohit Sharma should retire and legendary talent like Jay Shah lead the #IndianCricketTeam . RT and Like for support üçå pic.twitter.com/VW7IxjDb4Z ‚Äî Moe üí≠ (@MoiSpeaks) November 11, 2022 Scenes from Jay shah home. #INDvsENG pic.twitter.com/TiBWlFKY5X ‚Äî Prayag (@theprayagtiwari) November 10, 2022 Follow Us : Tags International Cricket Counci Jay Shah Related News India‚Äôs female cricketers to earn same amount of match fees as the men Jay Shah confirms India won‚Äôt travel to Pakistan for Asia Cup 2023 Roger Binny likely to replace Ganguly as BCCI President; Jay Shah to retain his position Two and half month window for IPL in ICC‚Äôs FTP Ganguly has not resigned, clarifies BCCI secretary Jay Shah after his tweet sparks speculation BCCI brass lays foundation stone for new National Cricket Academy

newsArray.title: T20 WC | Pakistan v England final and 10 different fan moods ‚Äì a psychological look
creator: The News Glory
newsArray.description: At a time when many Indian-Pakistani cricket fans were eagerly waiting for the India-Pakistan final match to be the final to decorate this T20 World Cup, the Indian team‚Äôs loss to England broke the hearts of many fans. In this case, the England-Pakistan final has been repeated on Australian soil after 1992. Opinions about it [‚Ä¶]
newsArray.content: At a time when many Indian-Pakistani cricket fans were eagerly waiting for the India-Pakistan final match to be the final to decorate this T20 World Cup, the Indian team‚Äôs loss to England broke the hearts of many fans. In this case, the England-Pakistan final has been repeated on Australian soil after 1992. Opinions about it are crawling. At that time Pakistan team led by Imran Khan defeated England and won the World Cup. Also, even now, Pakistan fans have longed to win the World Cup by defeating England. They are expressing this desire in many ways. A few quarters of Indian sentiments are comforted by the trend of ‚Äògood thing India-Pakistan would rather lose to England than lose to Pakistan in the final‚Äô. But, Indian fans are different‚Ä¶ everyone is different. This is about the final Let‚Äôs rank the various moods of Indian fans: India didn‚Äôt make it to the final either, so you can watch the England-Pakistan final without any tension. Pakistan is our enemy, so in the end that team should not win the trophy. England must win. England beat us very badly, so Pakistan should win, but England should never win. England should win, at least for Buttler. Babar Azam has just become the captain and Pakistan should not win the ICC trophy under the captaincy of Babar Azam till then. India lost to Zimbabwe and Pakistan was not a qualified team to win the trophy. After losing to Ireland and losing to Sri Lanka, England came to the last over and set a target of 140 runs to win the trophy. Who will win the final without ‚ÄòEn Thalaivan Kohli‚Äô playing? As soon as Dhoni left, cricket went away sir! Who won and what? What if you lose? Watch cricket cricket pro! American poet Wallace Stevens wrote the poem Thirteen Ways of Looking at a Blackbird. If you look at the England-Pakistan final as an object like that black bird, you can say that Indian fans see it in 10 ways, from 10 angles. (You can share the missing angles in the comment section) These are all different mindsets. It can be said that it is a plurality of moods. But all these are somewhat one-sided views. Even among those with a ‚Äòcricket as cricket pro‚Äô mentality, there will be people who hold such a grudge against India not qualifying for the finals. All these may somehow be centered on India-Pakistan political tension views. An alternative to these mindsets can be emphasized aesthetic vision. That is, enjoying the beauty of those cover drives, on drives, midwicket drives, cutshots by Babar Assam. Admiring Rizwan‚Äôs bullshot beauty. Or enjoying Ibtikhar‚Äôs middle-over prowess and his ability to hit sixes at intervals along with his unique cricketing skills. Or Buttler relishing Hales‚Äô brilliant shot selection, appreciating the subtleties of how Adil Rashid drops key players from Pakistan like Suryakumar Yadav when he schemed that day. Beyond wins and losses, a neutral view is to appreciate the techniques of cricket and the aesthetics of the game. It is good for physical/mental health to enjoy the match to improve the taste of cricket rather than cricket fanaticism fueled by hate politics. Maintaining a distance between the real world of the viewer‚Äôs self-awareness and the fictional world of a televised cricket match is called aesthetic distance. Because nowadays before a match, especially India-Pakistan match advertisements, media including digital and social media do not allow this aesthetic distance and force the fans to watch the match emotionally. The theory of aesthetic distancing can be of great help in getting rid of the emotional boiling point of attitudes caused by this crowded media. The German philosopher Immanuel Kant in his book Critique of Judgment describes a state of happiness that is selfless and devoid of self. There should be no desire or attachment to a particular object, let‚Äôs assume that in our environment cricket matches are especially India-Pakistan matches. Broadcast media has transformed it into an object or commodity. Therefore, what Immanuel Kant says is to relinquish the desire for a commodified object and enjoy the intrinsic beauty of that particular object or game or creation. That is, to temporarily put aside our self-created demands, our attitudes about the game, and our imposed thoughts and focus on the intrinsic beauty of the game and enjoy it is an example of a healthy, aesthetic mindset. Psychologists say that such aesthetic vision is a means of freeing us from narrow thoughts and elevating us. Not only cricket, but any creation, if we put it into such a perspective, it will free our self from the existing shackles and make us shape a different self.

newsArray.title: Pakistan vs England T20 World Cup Final, Live Streaming: When and where to watch PAK vs ENG T20 WC match?
creator: FirstCricket Staff
newsArray.description: Pakistan vs England T20 World Cup Final, Live Streaming: When and where to watch PAK vs ENG T20 WC match?
newsArray.content: A determined Babar Azam will be aiming to secure his seat beside the great Imran Khan in Pakistan cricket‚Äôs Hall of Fame as his team takes on a formidable England in the T20 World Cup final in Melbourne on Sunday.The passage of 2009 champions into the final could even beat a Hollywood thriller script as they were down and out after the first week of the tournament with morale-shattering defeats to arch-rivals India and Zimbabwe.Pakistan raised hopes of a dramatic comeback in the second week of a tournament with a win over South Africa and a prayer on their lips for some divine intervention.Just like in 1992, miracle happened when the Netherlands produced a performance for the ages to shock South Africa and out of nowhere, Pakistan were back in contention for a semifinal berth.But just like everyone wants a slice of ‚Äô92 from Babar‚Äôs team, the core of this current English team also has a date with history on this very Australian soil.Seven years ago in 2015, this was the country where England‚Äôs white ball cricket lay in tatters after they were dumped out of the competition at the group league stage by Bangladesh.The white ball cricket transformation started with horses for courses approach by the ECB, leading to a sea change in the mindset and intent of the English players. That fearless approach was on full display against India on Thursday.England have the ability to silence the 80,000 odd Pakistan fans, just like they did with the bulk of the 42,000 Indian fans in Adelaide.Pakistan vs England T20 World Cup Final details: When will Pakistan vs England T20 World Cup 2022 final match take place?The Pakistan vs England T20 World Cup 2022 final match will be played on Sunday, November 13.Where will Pakistan vs England T20 World Cup 2022 final match take place?The Pakistan vs England T20 World Cup 2022 final match will be played at the MCG in Melbourne.What time will Pakistan vs England T20 World Cup 2022 final match begin?The Pakistan vs England T20 World Cup 2022 final match will begin at 130 PM IST. The toss will take place at 1 PM IST.Where can you watch Pakistan vs England T20 World Cup 2022 final match live on TV in India?The Pakistan vs England T20 World Cup 2022 final match will be broadcast on Star Sports Network in India.Where can you watch Pakistan vs England T20 World Cup 2022 final match live streaming in India?The Pakistan vs England T20 World Cup 2022 final match will be available on Disney+ Hotstar website and app.(With PTI inputs)

newsArray.title: Dreams of ICC T20 World Cup shattered at Adelaide Oval
creator: Author
newsArray.description: as Englishmen hammer ‚ÄòMen in Blue‚Äô out of the tourney By V.N. Prasad Gloom of the Graveyard‚Äô engulfed 1.35 billion Indians and fans across the world as our boys failed to hold the nerves in an important/ crucial encounter and threw away the match in abject surrender. In lighter vein, we can only surmise that... The post Dreams of ICC T20 World Cup shattered at Adelaide Oval appeared first on Star of Mysore.
newsArray.content: as Englishmen hammer ‚ÄòMen in Blue‚Äô out of the tourney By V.N. Prasad Gloom of the Graveyard‚Äô engulfed 1.35 billion Indians and fans across the world as our boys failed to hold the nerves in an important/ crucial encounter and threw away the match in abject surrender. In lighter vein, we can only surmise that our boys pleased the Police Officers in Birmingham and Leicester. In an exhibition of masterclass, openers Jos Buttler (80 at 163 strike rate) and Alex Hales (86 at 182) went ‚ÄòHammer and Tongs‚Äô from the 1st over to script an unbroken partnership of 170 to humiliate India. Hearty congratulations to England on their massive victory. They proceed to Melbourne Cricket Grounds to play the finals against Pakistan on Sunday. Best to both the teams. Good contest is what we look forward to. T20 is a format where a combination of skill and risk taking works wonders. Strike rates of the top order determines the course of a match. As skipper Jos Buttler put it in the post match interview, he and Alex Hales could belt it out because he relied on team‚Äôs depth in batting. A ten-wicket victory in 16 overs chasing 168 is a great psychological advantage they carry into the finals. Best to the Engishmen on Sunday. On a hard and dry surface, Jos Buttler called it right and chose to bowl. Gloom set in as K.L. Rahul yet again got out with an awkward fishing attempt; a nothing shot; a sign of his diffidence in big games. The adverse impact of KLR‚Äôs dismissal was evident in skipper Rohit Sharma as he got out trying to accelerate. Thanks to some brilliant batting by Virat Kohli (50 at 125 strike rate) and Hardik Pandya (63 at 191), we could set a decent target of 168 at 8.45 strike rate. READ ALSO Remembering the legendary Martin David Crowe Though not a daunting target, it was defendable provided our bowlers had stuck to line and length in the first few overs to restrict the Englishmen through early wickets. But Bhuvneshwar Kumar, Arshdeep Singh, Mohammed Shami and Hardik Pandya were all wayward and leaked runs heavily. Surprisingly, well-flighted deliveries (sporadic though) caused anxiety in both Buttler and Hales. But both Axar Patel and Ashwin failed to watch and exploit their psyche as they too leaked runs heavily, bowling more of flat trajectory. Across tournaments, fact is that our seamers have been very inconsistent. Whereas they bowled superbly against Pakistan and South Africa, mediocrity was writ large against the English. While analysing the journey in this ICC T20 World Cup, we need to admit that it was never rosy. In the preliminaries, victories against Pakistan and Bangladesh were ‚ÄòTouch and Go‚Äô. Defeat to South Africa was ridiculous. All meaning that the management and the selectors have a lot to work on. They should be brave to ask a few to step aside and restructure the team. Novelty is the key and it needs guts. Cricket Talk Indian Cricket Team T20 World Cup 2022

newsArray.title: Pakistan vs England, T20 World Cup final: Afridi vs English openers and other key battles expected at the 'G'
creator: FirstCricket Staff
newsArray.description: Pakistan vs England, T20 World Cup final: Afridi vs English openers and other key battles expected at the 'G'
newsArray.content: Cricket Pakistan vs England, T20 World Cup final: Afridi vs English openers and other key battles expected at the 'G' With Pakistan facing England in a repeat of the 1992 ODI World Cup final this Sunday, we take a look at some of the match-ups in store for the clash at the MCG. FirstCricket Staff November 12th, 2022 16:43:31 IST Pakistan pacer Shaheen Shah Afridi celebrates a dismissal during their Super 12 clash against Netherlands. AP The 2022 T20 World Cup has nearly reached its conclusion, with just one match left in the itinerary ‚Äî the big final at the equally big ‚ÄòG‚Äô. Pakistan and England square off in the grand finale at the Melbourne Cricket Ground on Sunday in what will be a repeat of the 1992 ODI World Cup final, although this time it will be contested in the 20-over format. T20 World Cup: Full coverage | Schedule | Results | Points Table | News | Photos Both teams are coming off convincing victories in the semi-finals; Pakistan continued their fairy-tale run in the World Cup by comfortably chasing down the 153-run target set by New Zealand in the first semi-final in Sydney on Wednesday. The team that was staring at the prospect of an early flight back home instead finds itself on the cusp of a miracle. The India-England semi-final in Adelaide the following day was even more one-sided, with the opening pair of Jos Buttler and Alex Hales responding to the 169-run target set by the Men in Blue with an unbroken 170-run stand in just 16 overs, guiding the side to its third ICC World Cup final (both ODI and T20I) in four editions with the 10-wicket thrashing. Both teams have won one World Cup each ‚Äî Pakistan had followed their 2007 heartbreak with a victory over Sri Lanka in the 2009 final at Lord‚Äôs. England would then ended their wait for a maiden World Cup title by defeating arch-rivals Australia in the 2010 final in Bridgetown. The winner of the final on Sunday will join West Indies as one of the only two nations with multiple T20 World Cup wins. Ahead of the final, we take a look at some of the key battles and match-ups between the two sides: Shaheen Afridi vs Jos Buttler and Alex Hales Buttler and Hales are without a doubt the biggest talking point ahead of the final, given the manner in which they tore the hapless Indian bowling unit apart on Thursday. The pair has clicked brilliantly in this tournament and might just become England‚Äôs go-to opening combo in future games. Despite their 170-run unbroken stand, Buttler and Hales will be wary of the Pakistani bowling attack, especially Shaheen Shah Afridi. The left-arm pacer struggled initially in the tournament, but is peaking at the right time. Afridi had starred in the crucial win against Bangladesh with a four-wicket haul and got rid of dangerous opener Finn Allen early in the powerplay in the semi-final clash. And come Sunday, he‚Äôll hope his lethal yorkers are able to contain the firepower at the top of the English batting order. Mark Wood vs Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan English pacer Mark Wood could have an impact on the Pakistani top-order similar to what Afridi would against Buttler and Hales, provided he‚Äôs declared fit for the final and is brought back into the XI in place of Chris Jordan. Wood had complained of ‚Äústiffness‚Äù after their final Super 12 clash against Sri Lanka and had subsequently missed the semi-final clash against India. View this post on Instagram A post shared by ICC (@icc) Wood has been lethal throughout this tournament, going past the 150 kmph-mark far more often than any other bowler and the destruction that his sheer pace unleashes could help England get rid of Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan, the Pakistani opening pair that had looked patchy for the most part in the tournament but dominated the New Zealand attack on Wednesday with a 105-run stand. Iftikhar Ahmed vs left-arm seam Iftikhar Ahmed has been among the most consistent performers for Pakistan this year, dishing out match-winning performances in the Asia Cup earlier this year as well as in the ongoing T20 World Cup. The right-hand batter has collected two half-centuries so far in this tournament, against India and South Africa respectively, striking better than some of his superstar teammates who bat above him, and remains a vital cog in the middle-order. There is an area of concern for him though ‚Äî he had been dismissed five times by left-arm seamers in the seven-match T20I series against England before the T20 World Cup ‚Äî twice each by Sam Curran and David Willey and once by Luke Wood ‚Äî and once in the ongoing tournament (Mustafizur Rahman). Expect Buttler to deploy Curran, who is among the leading wicket-takers this tournament, to prise out this wicket. Moeen Ali vs Shadab Khan Moeen Ali‚Äôs form with the bat nosedived in the T20 World Cup after a stellar run in the Pakistan tour, where he also led the team in Buttler‚Äôs absence, and is due a big knock in this tournament. And given his ability to handle spin fairly well, he might just well be looked at as the man to tackle the Shadab Khan threat in the middle overs. Shadab himself has delivered with the ball consistently in this tournament besides also starring with the bat in the crunch game against South Africa, and the Englishmen will be wary of the threat that he poses besides the fiery pacers. It‚Äôs worth noting that Moeen has a strike rate of 177 in his head-to-head battle with Shadab in the shortest format. Ben Stokes vs Haris Rauf Should this contest turn into another nail-biter, if the weather gods permit the game to go ahead without a hitch that is, we could witness a contest for the ages in the death overs. England all-rounder and Test captain Ben Stokes has won many a match for his side across formats, including the 2019 ODI World Cup final, and his finishing abilities were once again on display in the Super 12 clash against Sri Lanka, where he steered his side to safety from a shaky position. Standing up when your country needs you. Shock horror, Ben Stokes gets it done. #T20WorldCup pic.twitter.com/meMHHgCofx ‚Äî England‚Äôs Barmy Army (@TheBarmyArmy) November 5, 2022 Haris Rauf, another Pakistani who has achieved worldwide fame with his lethal pace, is one of Pakistan‚Äôs favoured options for the death overs and a battle between Stokes and Rauf in the final four overs already sounds like a mouth-watering prospect. Rauf for once, would be hoping to bury the disappointment of getting hit for back-to-back sixes by Virat Kohli earlier in the tournament with a performance for the ages in the summit clash. newsArray.title: 'Aap Mein Or Hum Mein Fark Yehi Hai,' Irfan Pathan, Aakash Chopra give befitting reply to Pakistan PM for mocking Team India - Check
newsArray.description: Pakistan is set to take on England in the final of the ICC T20 World Cup 2022 at the Melbourne Cricket Ground.

newsArray.title: England aiming to add T20 World Cup to 50-over title ‚Äì final talking points
newsArray.description: England will attempt to win their second T20 World Cup title ‚Äì and only their third global International Cricket Council event ‚Äì when they take on Pakistan in Sunday‚Äôs final.
newsArray.content: England will attempt to win their second T20 World Cup title ‚Äì and only their third global International Cricket Council event ‚Äì when they take on Pakistan in Sunday‚Äôs final. A slice of history awaits if England were to emerge victorious as they would become the first team to hold the ODI and T20 World Cups simultaneously. Here, the PA news agency looks at the main topics of discussion. Will England turn to Wood and Malan? We need your consent to load this Social Media content We use a number of different Social Media outlets to manage extra content that can set cookies on your device and collect data about your activity. Please review their details and accept them to load the content. Manage Preference Injuries to Mark Wood‚Äôs right hip and Dawid Malan‚Äôs left groin saw the pair sidelined against India and, while a big blow for both, they were hardly missed as England seized a 10-wicket win. Head coach Matthew Mott said on Friday ‚Äúeverything would have to go right for them to be available at the moment‚Äù but Wood bowled what looked close to full tilt in the nets on Saturday while Malan had an extended batting session. Whether their outings at practice are enough to convince England of their fitness remains to be seen but they are no longer the major doubts they were at the start of the weekend. If they do come back in then it will probably be Chris Jordan and Phil Salt who drop out again. Pakistan go for 1992 repeat We need your consent to load this Social Media content We use a number of different Social Media outlets to manage extra content that can set cookies on your device and collect data about your activity. Please review their details and accept them to load the content. Manage Preference There are eerie parallels between the Pakistan side that memorably won the 1992 50-over World Cup and the campaign they have had here: early setbacks, three wins in a row to squeak into the knockout rounds and beating New Zealand in the semi-final to set up an MCG showdown against England. Pakistan will have their fingers crossed history repeats itself as they defeated Graham Gooch‚Äôs England 30 years ago. Ramiz Raja, the Pakistan Cricket Board chair, opened the batting on that day and regaled the contemporary side about that famous 22-run win earlier this week in an effort to inspire them. Daily Headlines & Evening Telegraph Newsletter Receive today's headlines directly to your inbox every morning and evening, with our free daily newsletter. Enter email address This field is required Sign Up Will the weather intervene? Expand Close Rain has been an unwelcome feature during the T20 World Cup visits to Melbourne (Scott Barbour/PA) PA / Facebook Twitter Email Whatsapp Rain has been an unwelcome feature during the T20 World Cup visits to Melbourne (Scott Barbour/PA) Several forecasts paint a bleak picture. The tournament‚Äôs previous visits to Melbourne have been soggy affairs, with three washouts and a rain-affected England-Ireland finale in six group stages matches. There is a reserve day on Monday but that could also be impacted by the weather, with the ICC changing its tournament rules as two hours have been added to allow play to continue into the evening in a bid to get at least 10 overs per side completed. If that cannot happen on either day then the underwhelming result would be the teams would share the trophy, bringing an ill-fitting end to the tournament. England‚Äôs last dance? Expand Close Jos Buttler insisted this England team can compete in future tournaments (PA) PA / Facebook Twitter Email Whatsapp Jos Buttler insisted this England team can compete in future tournaments (PA) In England‚Äôs 15-strong squad, only Phil Salt, Liam Livingstone, Sam Curran and Harry Brook are aged under 30. Moeen Ali and Malan are 35, Jordan and Adil Rashid are a year younger although Jos Buttler was adamant there remains plenty of life in the older dogs yet. The 32-year-old England captain said: ‚ÄúIn the professional age you can generally play a little bit longer if you look after yourself and of course there‚Äôs always plenty to play for.‚Äù With the 50-over World Cup in India next year, England will probably not look at regeneration until after then given how they have performed here. Beware Pakistan‚Äôs pace attack Expand Close Shaheen Shah Afridi has been terrific at the T20 World Cup (Rick Rycroft/AP) AP/PA Images / Facebook Twitter Email Whatsapp Shaheen Shah Afridi has been terrific at the T20 World Cup (Rick Rycroft/AP) Buttler and Alex Hales lit up the Adelaide Oval with their belligerent batting in England‚Äôs thrashing of India on Thursday. The MCG pitch, used in India‚Äôs win over Zimbabwe, has shorter straight and longer square boundaries in contrast to the ground they were presented with in the semi-final. Pakistan‚Äôs bowling attack has been the most formidable at this tournament with a fantastic economy rate ‚Äì quicks Shaheen Shah Afridi, Naseem Shah and Mohammad Wasim and leg-spinner Shadab Khan have been going at less than 6.7 an over. If England are to win then disrupting this quartet likely offers their best hope.

newsArray.title: Dhoni joining BJP?: Cricket fans can't keep calm as CSK captain meets Home Minister Amit Shah
newsArray.description: With a record of winning the most ICC trophies as a captain for India, Dhoni is India's most successful captain.

newsArray.title: BCCI secretary Jay Shah to head Finance and Commercial Affairs Committee of ICC
creator: FirstCricket Staff
newsArray.description: BCCI secretary Jay Shah to head Finance and Commercial Affairs Committee of ICC
newsArray.content: BCCI Secretary Jay Shah will add another feather to his cap as he is slated to head the influential Finance and Commercial Affairs committee of the International Cricket Council (ICC).The international cricket governing body‚Äôs Finance & Commercial Affairs committee decides budget allocations for ICC events and looks after the distribution of money to member countries from the overall revenue pool.More than a week prior to this weekend‚Äôs ICC Board meetings in Melbourne, the BCCI team, led by Jay Shah and IPL chairman Arun Dhumal, arrived in Australia. As the BCCI representative (BCCI president from 2019 to October) on the ICC Board, Shah took the seat of former India captain Sourav Ganguly.Dhumal will be a member of the chief executives‚Äô committee. More significantly, Shah will also be a member of the F&CA and is prepared to succeed Ross McCollum, the former chair of Cricket Ireland, who will be retiring soon, as chair of the committee at its next meeting in March 2023 as quoted by ESPNcricinfo.The ICC board unanimously re-elected Greg Barclay as the Independent Chair of the International Cricket Council (ICC) for a second two-year term as announced by the International cricket governing body on Saturday.Barclay was unopposed following the withdrawal of Tavengwa Mukuhlani from the process, and the Board reaffirmed its full support of him to continue as Chair for a further two years.Former Indian cricketer Roger Binny was elected as the 36th President of the Indian cricket body, BCCI, replacing Sourav Ganguly earlier in October after the 91st Annual General Meeting of the BCCI.Notably, Binny was the only candidate to have filed a nomination for the top post and ended Sourav Ganguly‚Äôs stint as BCCI President after three long years.Jay Shah continued to serve as the BCCI Secretary. Ashish Shelar was appointed as BCCI Treasurer. Rajeev Shukla was declared as the vice president, whereas Devajit Saikia was chosen as the joint secretary. Arun Dhumal was appointed as the IPL Chairman.
